comments.body: else part need to be handled with exception - password is mandatory or don't make passed argument optional in function definition
We wouldn't want to do anything if passwd is None because the user is not going to use `become_pass` if password is disabled for enable mode for the device.

comments.body: say If connection is throwing AnsibleConnectionFailure in exec_command due to socket timeout them _get_prompt value has no meaning right ? It might be last matched_prompt . Not sure why we need to do get_prompt here ?
we need to do get_prompt here so that we can return the exact prompt failure reason to the user thrown by the device.

            raise AnsibleConnectionFailure('unable to elevate privilege to enable mode, at prompt [%s] with error: %s' % (prompt, e.message))
